page.title: 11PLACES OF INTEREST.
page.content: GUN CARRIAGE CORNER took its name from the guns set at this strategic spot during World War 1 & World War 2. It is situated between Blind House Lane and Stone Street. The Pilgrims Way has been used for centuries; it is said to have been part of the network of prehistoric trade routes before it was used by Pilgrims passing to and from the Continent between places as far apart as Glastonbury and Compostella in Spain. Hempton Hill is said to have seen the arrest of one of the last highwaymen to be hung. He had the misfortune to hold up a high dignity of the Church who on arrival in Canterbury sent out the authorities to catch him as he was hiding in a house close by in a cul-de-sac known then as Black Jack's Hole.
